content: HR Policy is important as it provides direction in the growth of the organization and management of employees. It sets clear expectations, standards, and procedures, eliminating ambiguity and adhocism. It also enables clarity and norming of practices, guides standardization, and promotes faith in HR practices. Additionally, it helps in attracting and retaining committed employees, provides fair compensation, and rewards performance, ultimately leading to a healthy work environment.
